title: Spacing between conductors
fullText:
Conductors shall be adequately spaced to prevent contact with each other under all conditions of sag and sway.
The spacing between conductors at supports, measured in any direction, shall be not less than that shown in Table 3.10.
Exception: The spacing between conductors of a multi-core cable or cables operated in parallel may be less than that shown in Table 3.10.
NOTE: The electricity distributor may require a minimum clearance between consumer aerial lines and any electricity distributor aerial lines.
